body:
Ok, lately my hdd has had some issues. After a few hours running it would start making this screechy noise that would go on for a couple of seconds.

Today i come back from school, boot up my pc, and I get a popup from windows saying that the hard drive is broken and I should immediately make a backup. Anyway, haven't made the backup yet 'cause windows is stupid and it keeps failing on doing it.

Did some research and downloaded this tool to see my HDD's health, here's what I got (I am running a laptop btw, should be updating to a Desktop soon):
http://i.gyazo.com/32392144a965de13c73566ab2089a1bd.png
I don't care about losing anything because I don't have any importand files that I will lose. My games and all are in my steam library, so I've got nothing to worry about. 
What I am worried about is, my mother works on this computer (She makes digital albums). And I dont want her to lose all her work, and we're not in the best economic situation at the moment.
Any help on what I should do? I will ofc take it to someone to repair it, but the backup keeps failing, no idea why (Using a USB for it).
